questions.text: Program to improve quality of labor room comes under:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Laqshya

Highyeild:

Laqshya is a programme for improving quality of care in labour room and maternity OT. The quality improvement in labour room & maternity OT is assessed through NQAS (National Quality Assurance standards). Laqshya program: Laqshya programme of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare aims at improving quality of care in labour room and maternity OT. Reduce preventable maternal and newborn mortality, morbidity and stillbirths associated with the care around delivery in labour room and maternity OT and ensure respectful maternity care.

Random:

Explaination for incorrect options:- Option B. It will cover over 10 crore poor and vulnerable families (approximately 50 crore beneficiaries) providing coverage upto 5 lakh rupees per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization. Ayushman Bharat - National Health Protection Mission will subsume the on-going centrally sponsored schemes - Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY) and the Senior Citizen Health Insurance Scheme (SCHIS). Option C. Essential care is provided to the mother and her neonate within 48 hours. This postnatal period is critical for identification and management of complication of post-delivery. In case of institutional delivery. accessing availing this care is a little easier. Reasons like high out of pocket expenditure ondiagnostics/investigations, blood, drugs, food and user charges institutional delivery JSSK was launched in June 2011 to eliminate out-of-pocket expenses for institutional delivery of pregnant women and treatment of sick infants. Option D. The Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan has been launched by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MoHFW), Government of India. The program aims to provide assured, comprehensive and quality antenatal care, free of cost, universally to all pregnant women on the 9th of every month. Under the campaign, a minimum package of antenatal care services is to be provided to the beneficiaries on the 9th day of every month at the Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Clinics to ensure that every pregnant woman receives at least one checkup in the 2nd/ 3rd trimester of pregnancy. If the 9th day of the month is a Sunday / a holiday, then the Clinic should be organized on the next working day.

questions.text: A study was conducted on two different samples for comparing variation between DBP and Vitamin D. Diastolic blood pressure normal is 110 with standard deviation 11 and vitamin D levels normal 18 with standard deviation 3. Which of the sample has more variable?

options.label: A
options.text: DBP is more than Vitamin D

options.label: B
options.text: Vitamin D is more than DBP

options.label: C
options.text: Both DBP and Vitamin D will equal variability

options.label: D
options.text: It can't be ascertained from information provided

questions.correct_answer: B. Vitamin D is more than DBP
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vitamin D is more than DBP.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: Which is the study design of choice for finding out circadian variation of fat content in expressed breast milk of mother of preterm babies?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Prospective Cohort

Highyeild:

The study design of choice for the above mentioned scenario is prospective cohort as it is (the data) is to be assessed at the time of start of the study and the follow up is to be carried out in future date. Since we are checking circadian variation in breast milk with respect to fat content, we are doing a follow up study to assess fat content variation.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: In a study with new treatment, there were reported 36 deaths/treatment failures out of a sample of 120. With a new treatment, 26 treatment failures were reported from a sample size of 130. How many patients should be treated to avert 1 death?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

10

Highyeild:

NNT (Number needed to treat) Event No event Exp. group 26 104 130 Control group 36 84 120 Control group event rate (CER): no. of events(deaths)/total sample i.e. 36/120 = 0.3 Experimental group event rate (EER): no. of event (deaths)/total sample i.e., 26/130 = 0.2 Here question is asked about number needed to treat (NNT): 1/ARR So ARR (absolute risk reduction) : CER-EER : 0.3-0.2=0.1 So NNT: 1/ARR: 1/0.1= 10

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: Regarding ASHA all are true except:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Malaria slide preparation Options B, C and D are true statements .

Highyeild:

Malaria preparation is the work of MPW (M) = multi-purpose worker (male). Functions of ASHA worker include: Depot slide holder for essential drugs. Counselling of women for safe delivery & MCH practices. Immunization as per schedule.

Extraedge:

National Rural Health Mission (NRHM) 2005–12: One of the key components of this is to provide every village in the country with a trained female community health activist – ASHA (Accredited Social Health Activist) Proposed population norm: 2 ASHA workers per 1000 population (Village Level) Responsibilities of ASHA: Creating health awareness Mobilizing community in accessing health and health related services Depot holder for essential medicines like ORS, IFA etc. Providing primary medical care Home delivery of contraceptives (new responsibility under FP programme) Facilitating immunization Selection criteria of ASHA: Woman resident of local community Preferably 25 – 45 years’ age Literate with formal education up to VIII class

questions.text: A study was done to assess the risk factors for breast cancer in 100 females from urban cities. A statistical group and analysis is shown below. How many risk factors may be ascertained from the statistical analysis of the research?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

3

Highyeild:

In such type of studies, we need to see which factor’s range of 95% confidence index is more than 1 all the time, as 1 is taken as (no association). The factor’s whose range is less than 1 all the time is called protective factor. And the factor’s range which starts from less than 1 and goes more than 1 is considered not significant So in the given above study only 3studies ranges are greater than 1 all the time, so 3 is the answer Odds ratio: >1 positive association (risk factor). 1 = no association. <1= negative association (protective factor) CI range should be on either side of 1 throughout. (if odds ratio range contains value of 1 in between, no significant association).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: In a town of 20,000 populations, total 456 births were there in a year out of which 56 were dead born. The total death were 247 out of which 56 deaths were within 28 days of life and another 34 had dies after 28 days and before completing the first birthday. Calculate the infant mortality rate of the area?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

225

Highyeild:

Total no. of live births = total births - dead born i.e. 456 – 56 = 400. Total no. of deaths of infants within 1yr of age i.e. 56 + 34 = 90. So infant mortality rate is total no. of infant deaths/total live births *1000 i.e. (90/400) * 1000 = 225 per thousand live births.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and D are false.

questions.text: Seasonal variation of a disease studies in children in a group in June to July and in August to September in another group of similar character from the same area. The test of significance used to compare the data is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Chi square

Highyeild:

Comparison of two unrelated groups is done by chi square test. It means for the test of significance for non parametric data set. It is used for comparing % age, proportions and fractions in 2 or more different group of individuals. Since we are comparing seasonal variation (qualitative data) in 2 groups, we are using chi square test.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options B, C and D are false.

questions.text: A study was conducted to assess the effect of an intervention for a certain disease. The p values for two similar researches A and B with 95% confidence limits, was found to be 0.02 and 0.001 respectively using text "X" and "Y" with a control group. Based on preliminary analytic, the result may be interpreted as: Study B is more precise than study A and intervention Y is more significant compared to Intervention X for use in community. Study A is more precise than study B and intervention X is more significant compare d to Intervention Y for use in community. Both X and Y show a significant variation, but Study B is more significant than study A. Both study A and B shows a Significant variation and both interventions have similar statistically significance. Data is not sufficient to compare the investigations. Select the correct answer using the code below:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

If 1 and 3 are correct If p-value is less than 0.05 then the study is said to be significant. Here, both study A and study B are significant, but study B is highly significant. Based on this: Option A: Is a true statement. Option B: False as study B is more precise than study A. Option C: True. Option D: As both studies don’t have similar statistical significance. Option E: Data is sufficient. For Study A: P<0.05 significant value (precise but less than study B). For Study B: P< 0.001 highly significant (hence study B is more precise).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: The bone marrow density along with gestational age is plotted from two different researches. Which of the following is true for the relation between bone marrow density and gestational age?

options.label: A
options.text: Strength of relation is same in A and B

options.label: B
options.text: Strength of the relation is more in A than in B

options.label: C
options.text: Strength of the variation is more in B than A

options.label: D
options.text: Variation in variables is more with A than B

questions.correct_answer: B. Strength of the relation is more in A than in B
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Strength of the relation is more in A than in B.

Highyeild:

In the image A we can see the values are very near to the curve than in image B, this means strength of the relation of image A is strong and image B is weak, and variation of variables is more in image B, and less in image A. In a graphical presentation of correlation between 2 variables the direction of scatter helps to determine the presence or absence of association. In the first graph, values located just around graph (stronger correlation). But In 2nd graph, values located scattered around graph (weak correlation).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, C and D are false.

questions.text: Look at the image below. The correct corresponding answer is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Y=11+2x

Highyeild:

The given image is of a regression analysis graph. We need to remember the formulae Y=A + Bx. A = The point where the line meets on Y-axis when extended (i.e. intercept of slope on Y) i.e. 11. B = If the meeting point is making 45 degrees then it is considered as 1, more than 45 degree means more than 1, less than 45degree means less than 1 (slope coefficient or slope of the curve). So Y=11+2x y = a + bx y = regression coefficient a = intercept (value of y at x = 0)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Options A, B and D are false.

questions.text: Which immunization is useful in post disaster phase?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Measles

Highyeild:

Measles vaccine provides post exposure prophylaxis, if given within 3 days of exposure. WHO clearly states that typhoid and cholera vaccination is not indicated in disaster management. Gastrointestinal diseases and high chances of measles outbreak post disaster phase.

questions.text: True/False regarding AFP surveillance: AFP surveillance only till 5 years of age. Sample collected for suspected AFP even after 15 years At least one case non-polio AFP should be detected annually per 100,000 population Stool Specimen should reach the laboratory within 72 hours. At least 80% should have follow up after 60 days. Select the correct answer from the given below code:

options.label: A
options.text: A. = FALSE / B. = FALSE / C. = TRUE / D. = TRUE / E. = TRUE).

options.label: B
options.text: A. = TRUE / B. = FALSE / C. = TRUE / D. = TRUE / E. = TRUE).

options.label: C
options.text: A. = FALSE / B. = TRUE / C. = TRUE / D. = TRUE / E. = FALSE).

options.label: D
options.text: A. = FALSE / B. = FALSE / C. = TRUE / D. = TRUE / E. = FALSE).

questions.correct_answer: A. A. = FALSE / B. = FALSE / C. = TRUE / D. = TRUE / E. = TRUE).
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A. = FALSE / B. = FALSE / C. = TRUE / D. = TRUE / E. = TRUE). Option A. False: surveillance is done till 15 years. Option B. False: sample is collected upto 15 years, not after 15 Option C. True: AFP reporting rate should be more than 1 per 100000 population (i.e. sensitive enough to detect at least 1 AFP for every 100,000 < 15 yrs old children Population.) Option D. True: both 1st and 2nd sample should reach the laboratory within 72hrs. Option E. True: this is for residual paralysis.

Highyeild:

WHO indicators of AFP surveillance and Lab performance: Non Polio AFP Rate in children < 15 years of age: ≥ 2 per 1,00,000. Reported AFP cases with 2 stool specimens collected < 14 days since paralysis onset: > 80%.
